strings.Value: "Stop! What are you doing?"
"Pondering how to make the most perfect dive to the rocks below, are you?"
"What are you waiting for? Jump!"
"Care to tell me who you are?"
"So you're the Dragon's Voice, right?"
"You know who I am?"
"Is it your house south of here?"
"Tell me, was it you who gave the villagers Silver Dragon's scales?"
"We'll talk another time. Bye!"
[Attack] "Dragon's Voice or not, this place can only have one ruler, and that's me!"
"We have no need to fight each other. I won't harm either you or the village."
"I am the sole ruler of these lands. Never forget it."
"Watch your tongue!"
"I understand why you are suspicious."
"May I have an audience with this 'Lord Dragon' of yours?"
"I'm not hiding my identity — in fact, I've nothing to hide at all."
"Was that a threat?"
"I'll take that as a compliment!"
"I know about your family. I'm… sorry for your loss."
"I found your oh-so-inspiring letter to your poor, dead wife."
"There were some papers around the house..."
"The tales you tell! These scales belong to a wyvern."
"I don't know why you keep lying to the villagers, but your lies won't work with me. I know about the wyvern."
"Lies, even seemingly-harmless ones, never end well."
"People are gullible. Using that weaknesses to your own benefit? I respect that."
"Are you trying to tell me, that even after you've lost your family, you still don't realize what damage lies can do?"
"In any case, not every made-up story is a bad thing."
"All right then, let me ask you few more questions."
"Do as you wish. Farewell!"
"I learned what I wanted. Farewell!"
{n}A tall, red-headed man dressed in hunter's clothes is balancing at the brink of this cliff — one wrong move and he'll fall into the chasm.{/n}
"Oh no, not at all. Many would like to silence the Dragon's Voice. I won't give them the pleasure." {n}The redhead turns around and nods.{/n} "...Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}."

"Well, it would be rude not to introduce myself. My name is Ivar." {n}The red-headed man watches you closely, but makes no move to run or draw his weapons.{/n} "If you passed through the village, you must have heard rumors about me. Once, I used to be a simple hunter, but now I keep the peace in this region by the order of their lord, the Silver Dragon."
"That's what people call me." {n}The red-headed man smiles slightly.{/n} "These lands are under protection of the Silver Dragon. And I'm his most trusted servant."
"That's exactly what every new self-proclaimed {mf|king|queen} usually says."

{n}The red-headed man gives a crooked smile as if you've confirmed his opinion, then he shrugs.{/n} "I didn't want to offend you. But I know your kind. You always want something for yourself — power, money, fame... all I want is peace for these people. You and I, we're on different paths."
{n}The red-headed man bows his head.{/n} "Well, forgive me for being so harsh. I just wanted you to remember — these lands don't need new rulers. A protector is enough."
"Don't be so eager to put a crown on your head! Remember, {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen}, this village is under my protection."
{n}He smiles slightly.{/n} "You waste your time — I cannot be bought, with gold, a maiden's kiss, or magic. Even if you were to try — and you're welcome to — the Dragon won't speak to anyone but me."
"I know everything that happens in the village and for leagues around. Of course I was aware of your arrival — such a prestigious guest, striding into our lands."

{n}The red-headed man raises an eyebrow.{/n} "That so? Well. Honesty is a virtue, and one that's hard to find these days. Especially if we're talking about kings, queens, and any who seeks to rule others. What do you want to ask me about, {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen}?"

"I don't waste my breath on threats."{n}The redheaded man is gazing at you coldly.{/n} "My way is a simple one — those who come in peace are welcome. Those who threaten the village don't live long enough to regret it."
"Just don't take it as flattery." {n}He scoffs, but there is no malice in it.{/n} "Boot-licking the highborn? Never one of my habits."
"It's mine. So what?"
"I don't look for sympathy. And don't expect it." {n}Ivar falls silent for a moment and looks away.{/n} "Besides… I don't deserve it."

{n}Ivar frowns, and his fists clench… but he regains control almost immediately.{/n} "I should have watched over my papers more carefully... Though... what difference does it make? What would it change?" {n}He shakes his head bitterly.{/n}
{n}He tenses.{/n} "It was me, yes. Who else except for the Dragon's Voice would do that?"

{n}Ivar's face darkens.{/n} "Storyteller, you say? If you only knew, what price I had to pay for my stories... Yes! I lied to the villagers, but the people needed something to believe in. If they need a fairy-tale dragon — I give them a fairy-tale dragon."

{n}Ivar stiffens.{/n} "Nothing gets by you, I see. Hnh. Yes! I feed wild wyvern from time to time and bring her scales to the village. People need to believe in something. So let them believe they live under protection of the Dragon."
"Don't be so quick to judge, {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen}. You may think you know a lot, but every wise man knows there's always more to learn."
"Not too honorable though."{n}Ivar smiles sadly.{/n}
{n}Ivar laughs, relaxing slightly.{/n} "Luckily, people don't talk about those kind of dragons yet."
"I wonder how would you deal with it, if, according to the legend, the dragon was, let's say, a bright pink with sunflower spots!"
"You want to know if I regret about telling lies to the villagers? Yes, I do, but I can't find another way. So, enough about that!"
"We can both agree on that, {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen}."
"Why are you so sure that this "another time" will happen? I won't stay here long. There's an old saying — sluggish wolf soon starves."
"And they are?..."
